On 20/01/06, Elliotte Harold <elharo@...> wrote:
> David Saff w=
rote:
>
> > None is the default value of the expected attribute on the Test=

> > annotation.  It is not intended for outside use.  Thanks,
>
> Can this=
 be made non-public then?

Why should it be non-public?

Although it is the=
 default, I could imagine a situation where you
would want to note explicit=
ly that no exception is expected from a
test. If the None value was non-pub=
lic, this would not be possible.

(Most likely situation: several test case=
s that do expect exceptions,
with one that doesn't - the use of None would =
document very clearly
that the exception is not expected)
